decks.notes: The deck focuses on creating a loop with Witch's Oven, Cauldron Familiar, and Mayhem Devil to deal consistent damage to the opponent while gaining value from sacrificing creatures. It also includes cards like Scavenger's Talent and Bloodtithe Harvester to disrupt the opponent's game plan and gain an advantage. The deck utilizes a mix of removal spells like Fatal Push and Claim the Firstborn to control the board and maintain pressure. Additionally, Fable of the Mirror-Breaker can provide card advantage and Den of the Bugbear can offer a strong finisher.

This deck focuses on using the combo of Greasefang and Parhelion II to overwhelm the opponent. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize while also utilizing cards such as Monument to Endurance and Guardian of New Benalia to support the combo pieces. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure a smooth and consistent gameplay experience, allowing the player to efficiently cast their spells and overwhelm the opponent with powerful synergies.

This deck focuses on utilizing the combo with Greasefang and Parhelion II to generate powerful board presence and overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes various support cards such as Guardian of New Benalia and Monument to Endurance to protect and enhance the combo pieces. Additionally, cards like Seasoned Hallowblade and Fatal Push provide additional utility and removal options. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the combo while giving flexibility in casting spells. The strategy is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and overpower the opponent before they can respond effectively.

The deck revolves around utilizing a variety of control spells and enchantments to disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain board control. It also focuses on card advantage and searching for specific answers with cards like Memory Deluge and Consult the Star Charts. With the inclusion of Yorion as a companion, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent by consistently blinking permanents for additional value. The deck also includes a mix of powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and versatile removal options like Supreme Verdict to deal with a wide range of threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful equipment cards like Colossus Hammer and Sigarda's Aid to quickly buff up creatures like Kellan, the Fae-Blooded and Cori-Steel Cutter for aggressive plays. Cards like Mox Amber and Inspiring Vantage help ramp up mana quickly for explosive turns, while cards like Kazuul's Toll Collector and Dragonfire Blade provide additional support and removal options. This deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast, efficient creatures and equipment to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The Boros Aggro archetype emphasizes speed and aggression to secure victories in Pioneer 1 vs 1 matches.

This deck focuses on assembling the Greasefang and Parhelion II combo to create a powerful, game-ending board state. The deck includes cards that provide protection and disruption to help set up the combo, such as Seasoned Hallowblade and Thoughtseize. Additionally, the deck includes various lands and support cards to help maintain a strong board presence and control the game. Overall, the key strategy of this deck is to efficiently assemble and protect the combo pieces while disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm your opponent with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells in order to quickly close out the game. By using a combination of efficient removal and discard spells like Fatal Push, Thoughtseize, and Duress, you aim to disrupt your opponent's game plan while deploying threats like Bloodtithe Harvester, Fable of the Mirror-Breaker, and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to apply pressure and finish the game. The deck also includes key cards like Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger and Graveyard Trespasser to provide additional disruption and advantage in longer matches.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, board wipes, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating incremental advantages through cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. The inclusion of Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion provides additional value and synergy with the deck's game plan. The deck also includes some land destruction and card draw elements to further disrupt the opponent and maintain control of the game.

The main focus of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy through hand disruption like Thoughtseize and Duress, removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat, and powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and The Meathook Massacre to control the battlefield. With a combination of disruption, removal, and threats, this deck aims to outvalue and outgrind the opponent in a slower, more controlling match. The deck also utilizes land synergies with cards like Unholy Annex / Ritual Chamber and Mutavault.

This Rakdos Aggro deck is focused on applying pressure through aggressive creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger, while disrupting opponents with Duress and Thoughtseize. The deck also utilizes removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to clear the way for attacks. With a mix of threats and disruption, the deck aims to close out games quickly by overwhelming opponents with its efficient creatures and spells.

This deck focuses on using Enigmatic Incarnation to search for powerful creatures and enchantments to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It utilizes a variety of versatile creatures and removal spells to maintain board control while ramping up towards bigger threats. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color requirements and includes various fetch lands for consistency. The strategy is to outvalue the opponent by constantly generating advantage through powerful creatures and enchantments while disrupting their game plan.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on aggressively disrupting the opponent's hand and board while building up a strong battlefield presence with its creature spells. The deck combines efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat with resilient threats like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Bloodtithe Harvester. By utilizing a mix of disruption, efficient creatures, and powerful finishers, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and decisively. Additionally, it takes advantage of cards like Thoughtseize and Duress to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain tempo advantage.

The key concept of this deck is to create a powerful combo using Greasefang, Okiba Boss and Parhelion II, supported by cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push for control. The deck also includes creatures like Fleeting Spirit and Seasoned Hallowblade for additional support and protection. The combination of these cards allows for a strong combo strategy while maintaining control over the game with removal and protection spells. The land base and other support cards are designed to maximize the effectiveness of the combo and ensure the deck runs smoothly and efficiently.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game using various removal spells, discard spells and powerful creatures like Liliana of the Veil. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy by taking away their key cards with Thoughtseize and Duress, while also keeping the board under control with cards like Go for the Throat and Fatal Push. The creatures in the deck provide additional win conditions and value, with Graveyard Trespasser and Gifted Aetherborn helping to stabilize the board. The land base ensures consistency and provides the necessary mana to cast the spells efficiently.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quick and aggressive creature plays combined with disruption spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck includes a mix of powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat. Additionally, the inclusion of Thoughtseize and Duress helps to disrupt the opponent's hand and prevent them from executing their game plan effectively. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent while maintaining control of the game.

The deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with low-cost creatures and using spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan. By efficiently deploying threats and disrupting the opponent's strategy, the Boros Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory. With a combination of aggressive creatures, removal spells, and powerful lands, the deck seeks to apply pressure from the early turns of the game and maintain tempo to close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.
